creator: michel.vanavermaete@es.eureka.be
text:
Hello,

I am using the Batik SVGGenerator to generate a chart using JFreeChart to build 
it.
This works fine and I get an SVG file (see below).
I use FOP to generate pdf reports in which I want to include this chart.

When Batik has to parse the SVG file it comes to an error. (see summary).
I tryed the same using the JSVGCanvas to check if here the parsing works but I 
got the same problem. Here is the code

Can you help me in fixing this ??

Many thanks
Michel Vanavermaete (Brussels, Belgium)

public class MainStart {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello World");
        JFrame f = new JFrame("Batik");
        JSVGCanvas component = new JSVGCanvas();
        component.setURI("file:Source/test.svg");
        f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() {
            public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {
                System.exit(0);
            }
        });
        f.getContentPane().add(component);
        f.pack();
        f.setSize(400, 400);
        f.setVisible(true);

    }
}

here is the SVG document:

Can you provide more info on the error?
Also if you attach the svg as an attachment then line-wrapping doesn't
screw up the file (as it is it would take awhile to get the file to run).
creator: deweese@apache.org

text: If you want to attach the example as an attachment and reopen the bug.
creator: deweese@apache.org
